revised_title: Peripheral Neurosecretory and Sensory Neurons in Stick Insects
tldr: The study investigates the peripheral neurons and peripheral neurosecretion in the stick insect, Carausius morosus. It identifies two groups of neurons: group A, which is probably sensory, and group B, which is actively neurosecretory. The research also discovers five types of neurosecretory granules and maps their distribution in the insect's abdominal segments. This work provides insights into the complex nervous system of stick insects and their neurosecretory functions.
